data.title: Bruce Willis wife Emma Heming Willis celebrates 15th Wedding Anniversary
data.meta_description: Bruce Willis' wife, Emma Heming Willis, has shared a loving tribute to her husband on their 15th wedding an...
data.text:
Bruce Willis' wife, Emma Heming Willis, has shared a loving tribute to her husband on their 15th wedding anniversary.

Taking to Instagram, she shared a casual photo of the Die Hard star, who is currently battling frontotemporal dementia (FTD), planting a sweet kiss on her lips.

"Today marks our 15th wedding anniversary! And today, I can make a choice. I can wallow in sorrow or I can celebrate it. I call this the 'remarkable reframe'," the former model wrote.

READ MORE: Brooke Boney opens up about 'difficult' choice to leave dream Today role

"What I know is there is so much to celebrate. Our union and connection is probably stronger than ever. We have two bright, fun and healthy daughters. We have a family unit that is built on mutual respect and admiration. And simply, I just love and adore the man I married.

"I'm so proud of what we have and continue to create. So, happy crystal anniversary to us!"

The pair share two daughters, Mabel Ray, 11, and Evelyn Penn, nine.

She also posted a photo of them holding hands, with a tattoo on Willis' finger reading "321".

READ MORE: The one thing many people have wrong about Costeen Hatzi, girlfriend of Nick Kyrgios

Emma captioned the photo, 3/21/09, the date they got married.

It comes just two days after the Pulp Fiction actor's blended family sent him overwhelming birthday wishes for his 69th birthday.

Uploading a photo of Willis holding one of his children as a baby, Emma wrote, "Just like you, we simply adore him. What you might not know, but maybe you could imagine, that being wrapped in his arms is the safest place in this whole wide world. He's a true gentle-man," she said.

"With so much love to give and share. That's what I get to see, his true core. I can tell you, it's so pure and ever so good.

"Happy Birthday my love. You are the gift that keeps giving ðŸ’ž."

His eldest daughter, Rumer Willis, also gave a heartfelt tribute.

Rumer, 35, shared a series of pictures of the pair together over the years in her Instagram post, writing: "Oh Daddio, to be loved by you is such a gift."

"You are the funniest, most tender, charming, out of this world silly talented and magical papa. Looking through these photos this morning I am just filled with the deepest gratitude that we chose to spend this life together," she wrote.

"I am your first baby and man sometimes I wish I could be tiny enough to just cozy up on your chest again and laugh and cuddle you. I love you so deep in my bones I don't know how my muscles hold them."
